item.title: By: rogerglewis
item.dc:creator: rogerglewis
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2019/03/30/magnapedia-newport-west-sovereign-brexit-primary-poll/comment-page-1/#comment-2093">alisonfletch</a>.
Thanks, Alison, The Newport By-Election is on Radio Silence clearly the Establishment does not want a political upset. Hopefully, we can get our WikPeople Portal up and running to get some independent and sovereign Brexit MP's representing people as citizens rather than as a Customer service department for Global corporations. Best Wishes, Roger
item.content:encoded:
In reply to alisonfletch.

Thanks, Alison,
The Newport By-Election is on Radio Silence clearly the Establishment does not want a political upset.
Hopefully, we can get our WikPeople Portal up and running to get some independent and sovereign Brexit MP’s representing people as citizens rather than as a Customer service department for Global corporations.
Best Wishes,
Roger

item.title: By: The U.K. Commons Has Grabbed Power From The Executive. Time For ‘The People’ To Grow Some Power Against The Commons – RogersLongHairBlog
item.dc:creator: The U.K. Commons Has Grabbed Power From The Executive. Time For ‘The People’ To Grow Some Power Against The Commons – RogersLongHairBlog

item.title: By: rogerglewis
item.dc:creator: rogerglewis
item.description: 1060-5420 I made this poll and used the first code, the plan is to have automated poll software which will scrape the Wiki page made in individual instances of whatever the vote is for or about. Primarily motivation has been to develop a method of wiki page composition and a virtual primary process so as not to split the sovereign Brexit vote at the next UK general election.
item.content:encoded:
1060-5420 I made this poll and used the first code, the plan is to have automated poll software which will scrape the Wiki page made in individual instances of whatever the vote is for or about.
Primarily motivation has been to develop a method of wiki page composition and a virtual primary process so as not to split the sovereign Brexit vote at the next UK general election.
